title: Microplastics: A Tiny Threat
content: - Microplastics are tiny plastic particles less than 5 millimeters in size.
They come from a variety of sources, including the breakdown of larger plastic items, industrial processes, and personal care products.
Microplastics are found in oceans, lakes, rivers, and even our food.
image_desc: A close-up image of microplastics under a microscope, showing their small size and irregular shapes.
narration: Microplastics are a growing concern for our environment and health. These tiny particles are everywhere, from the deepest oceans to the food we eat.  Let's dive deeper into the world of microplastics and understand their impact.
